bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 152 (Wednesday, September 20, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. OGLES:H.R. 5602.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:This bill requires the Federal Reserve to report on risksto the financial system.[Page H4439]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Interest Rate Risk Reporting Act

This bill requires the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to address interest rate risk during semiannual hearings before Congress. The board must address the vulnerability of the U.S. financial system to interest rate risk and the exposure of assets held by the board and Federal Reserve banks.

bill.title: Interest Rate Risk Reporting Act

item.title: To amend the Federal Reserve Act to require the Chairman of the Board to address interest rate risk when appearing at semi-annual hearings before the Congress.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
